message: @Thomasknoll Wow, that was quick. I didn't even have time to suggest a site like this: instantdomainsearch.com (just with a recommendation engine if you have multiple suggested fragments)
http://domai.nr/
So far my favorite one is NameNinja.com

What do you all recommend for domain name lookup? Should be a clutter free site that tells me if a domain name is available, cheap places to register them and whois info if it's taken. Ideally it should look like something developed in this decade and not a relic from a registrar that pimps it's own services all over the site. Bonus points if it does domain name recommendations by letting you specify multiple terms and quick instant lookups. Alternatively, a custom use desktop Mac app would be nice too.
I have been using EuroDns.com recently to look but haven't purchased through them. They give you a readout of every kind you could possibly get and who owns it if its already taken.
I'm a huge fan of domize.com. Their mobile site works really well too.
@initialsSAM +1 on domize.com
I like http://www.bustaname.com/ as a domain name brainstorming tool.
@Kuroir that autocomplete is quick, how u so quick nameninja?
domai.nr has some caveats like all .lb domains need a .com .net .org etc prior to the .lb  however they do not account for that.
DomainTools.com all the way, very easy to navigate!
Iwantmyname.com is fun to use as well. They have great hosting, apps, add-ons, social features, and great deals. They have my vote :)
Terminal.  whois <domain>

Mind you, it has limited functionality, so whenever it fails on a domain (usually with uncommon TLDs) I just use my own host, namecheap, so that if I want the domain, I can instantly register it if it's free.
I'm always skeptical of new or unknown tools for domain lookups. It is probably borderline paranoia, but I'm always afraid they are secretly going to steal my domain name from me. :)

A little bit of everything, depending on why I care. Sometimes I'll just open up a tab and visit the website to decide if I even want to look into it (often there's a website there already, which makes the answer to the question of whether or not the domain is available pretty clear). Otherwise it's some random element of {domai.nr, NameCheap, terminal's whois}
visit the domain* that is.
heh?
Answering my own question, looks like I bookmarked this a while ago and forgot about it: http://domaingroovy.com
I find myself looking up domains on http://who.is usually.
Personally I use: http://instantdomainsearch.com/
https://domaintyper.com/

Just don't use networksolutions.com. I was trying different domains, found some I liked and then called my godaddy rep to buy them. He said networksolutions had put those domains on a temporary purchase so I would have to wait a week before I could buy them from a different registrar.
I'm a big fan of http://domai.nr/
@ali +1 for domai.nr (their availability check's a bit broken though. It's a bit of a downer when it says the perfect domain name is available, then you find out it's actually not.)
@micrypt it could have been available, but as you search for them they got temporary registered.
either http://domai.nr/ or http://who.is
www.bustaname.com or www.dotomator.com
